info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 5 at 11:18AM EDT until June 5 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of the Piedmont in North Carolina, including the following county, Cabarrus.
* WHEN...Until 215 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1114 AM EDT, Emergency Managemer reported Wolf Meadow Branch coming out of its banks with water over the bridge on Stough Road between April Ct and Pebblebrook Cir SW. Minor flooding is ongoing. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kannapolis, Downtown Concord, West Concord, Davidson, Harrisburg, Mt Pleasant, Charlotte Motor Speedway and Coddle Creek Reservoir. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via X using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
